content.description:
Steep, cracks, crystals, flakes, and fun, Well protected,

 Vic's Strut is the name of a polka song named after my dad. He was a great polka dancer and an even greater dad.
content.protection: 6 Bolts and a couple of small fingers sized cams. 2 bolt anchor with rap rings that is shared with 'Jig 'em Up. You Rectums'.
content.location: Start about 50' right of a right facing corner/detached flake. perched 20' up the wall, and about 20' right of  'Jig em Up, You Rectums'. The first 2 bolts protect a rising traverse.

climbs.name: Jig 'em Up, You Rectums
climbs.fa: Ben Miller, John Halupowski, Laura Halupowski. August 21, 2017

content.description: Face climbing on highly featured rock.  Climb up and right.  As you clip the third bolt, you are standing on a foot ledge.  Traverse horizontally right approximately eight feet to reach a right facing, hard to see, flake with bomber holds.  Up the flake and over a bulge to easier ground.  Rap rings, (the last bolt and the rap rings are shared with Vic's Strut),  lie above the overlap, just out of sight.
content.protection: Six quick draws.  Best if one them is double length for the last bolt.
content.location: On the left end of the Berlin Wall.  Just left, and above this route, is a huge right facing corner/detached flake.

content.description: Great climbs on high quality rock. Climbs feel like Rumney.
